info.title: API Reference
info.description:
The Finch HRIS API provides a unified way to connect to a multitide of HRIS systems. The API requires an access token issued by Finch.

By default, Organization and Payroll requests use Finch's [Data Syncs](/development-guides/Data-Syncs). If a request is made before the initial sync has completed, Finch will request data live from the provider. The latency on live requests may range from seconds to minutes depending on the provider and batch size.
For automated integrations, Deductions requests (both read and write) are always made live to the provider. Latencies may range from seconds to minutes depending on the provider and batch size.


Employer products are specified by the product parameter, a space-separated list of products that your application requests from an employer authenticating through Finch Connect. Valid product names are—
- `company`: Read basic company data

- `directory`: Read company directory and organization structure

- `individual`: Read individual data, excluding income and employment data

- `employment`: Read individual employment and income data

- `payment`: Read payroll and contractor related payments by the company

- `pay_statement`: Read detailed pay statements for each individual

- `benefits`: Create and manage deductions and contributions and enrollment for an employer

[![Open in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/21027137-08db0929-883d-4094-a9ce-dbf5a9bee4a4?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D21027137-08db0929-883d-4094-a9ce-dbf5a9bee4a4%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3D1edf19bc-e0a8-41e9-ac55-481a4b50790b)

get.description: Read company directory and organization structure

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of employees to return (defaults to all)

post.description: Read individual data, excluding income and employment data
Read individual employment and income data

get.description: Read payroll and contractor related payments by the company.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date to retrieve payments by a company (inclusive) in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date to retrieve payments by a company (inclusive) in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

post.description:
Read detailed pay statements for each individual.

Deduction and contribution types are supported by the payroll systems that supports Benefits.

payment_id.description: A stable Finch `id` (UUID v4) for a payment.

limit.description: Number of pay statements to return (defaults to all).

get.description: Read company pay groups and frequencies
Read information from a single pay group
List all company-wide deductions and contributions.

post.description: Creates a new company-wide deduction or contribution. Please use the `/providers` endpoint to view available types for each provider.

value.message: Provider does not support benefit type '401k'

post.description: Register existing benefits from the customer on the provider, on Finch's end. Please use the `/provider` endpoint to view available types for each provider.

value.message: This adapter does not support assisted benefits.

get.description: Lists deductions and contributions information for a given item

post.description: Updates an existing company-wide deduction or contribution

get.description: Lists individuals currently enrolled in a given deduction.
Get enrollment information for the given individuals.

parameters.name: individual_ids
parameters.description: comma-delimited list of stable Finch uuids for each individual. If empty, defaults to all individuals

post.description: Enroll an individual into a deduction or contribution. This is an overwrite operation. If the employee is already enrolled, the enrollment amounts will be adjusted. Making the same request multiple times will not create new enrollments, but will continue to set the state of the existing enrollment.

individual_id.description: Finch id (uuidv4) for the individual to enroll

200.description: Success for all individuals. Enrolled new individuals in the benefit and upserted information for individuals already enrolled.

body.name: created
body.message: Successfully enrolled new benefit for individual

207.description: Multi-Status. Some individuals may not have succeeded. See body for details.

body.name: created
body.message: Successfully enrolled new benefit for individual

value.name: unprocessable_request_error
value.message: HSA enrollment are not currently available for this provider

delete.description: Unenroll individuals from a deduction or contribution

200.description: Success for all individuals. Unenrolled all individuals from the benefit.

207.description: Multi-Status. Some individuals may not have succeeded. See body for details.

post.description: Exchange the authorization code for an access token

get.description: Return details on all available payroll and HR systems.

connection_status.message: This employer has created a token, and we are waiting for access to its provider
This employer is working as expected

get.description: Read account information associated with an `access_token`

post.description: Disconnect one or more `access_token`s from your application.

The Forward API allows you to make direct requests to an employment system. If Finch’s unified API
doesn’t have a data model that cleanly fits your needs, then Forward allows you to push or pull
data models directly against an integration’s API.

headers.description: The HTTP headers of the forwarded request’s response, exactly as received from the underlying integration’s API.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the forwarded request’s response, exactly received from the underlying integration’s API. This value will be returned as an integer.

data.description: A string representation of the HTTP response body of the forwarded request’s response received from the underlying integration’s API. This field may be null in the case where the upstream system’s response is empty.

request.description: An object containing details of your original forwarded request, for your ease of reference.

method.description: The HTTP method that was specified for the forwarded request. Valid values include: `GET` , `POST` , `PUT` , `DELETE` , and `PATCH`.

route.description: The URL route path that was specified for the forwarded request.

headers.description: The specified HTTP headers that were included in the forwarded request. If no headers were specified, this will be returned as `null`.

params.description: The query parameters that were included in the forwarded request. If no query parameters were specified, this will be returned as `null`.

data.description: The body that was specified for the forwarded request. If a value was not specified in the original request, this value will be returned as null ; otherwise, this value will always be returned as a string.

get.description: Get all automated jobs. Automated jobs are completed by a machine. By default, jobs are sorted in descending order by submission time. For scheduled jobs such as data syncs, only the next scheduled job is shown.

limit.description: The number of items to return. Defaults to 100.

offset.description: Where in the list of jobs to start returning from. Defaults to index 0.

quotas.description: Information about remaining quotas for this connection. Only applicable for customers opted in to use Finch's Data Sync Refresh endpoint (`POST /jobs/automated`). Please contact a Finch representative for more details.

value.message: could not find job with id job-fb3b25dc-02dc-48eb-9cfc-3f9837276884
value.name: not_found_error

post.description:
Enqueue an automated job. Currently, only the `data_sync_all` job type is supported, which will enqueue a job to re-sync all data for a connection. `data_sync_all` has a concurrency limit of 1 job at a time per connection. This means that if this endpoint is called while a job is already in progress for this connection, Finch will return the `job_id` of the job that is currently in progress. Finch allows a fixed window rate limit of 1 forced refresh per hour per connection.

This endpoint is available for *Scale* tier customers as an add-on. To request access to this endpoint, please contact your Finch account manager.

type.description: The type of job to start. Currently the only supported type is `data_sync_all`

job_id.description: The id of the job that has been created.

job_url.description: The url that can be used to retrieve the job status

allowed_refreshes.description: The number of allowed refreshes per hour (per hour, fixed window)

remaining_refreshes.description: The number of remaining refreshes available (per hour, fixed window)

202.description: Accepted. This response will be returned if a job is already enqueued for the connection. This case does not consume any job quota as it just returns the details of an existing job.

job_id.description: The id of the job that has been created.

job_url.description: The url that can be used to retrieve the job status

allowed_refreshes.description: The number of allowed refreshes per hour (per hour, fixed window)

remaining_refreshes.description: The number of remaining refreshes available (per hour, fixed window)

allowed_refreshes.description: The number of allowed refreshes per hour (per hour, fixed window)

remaining_refreshes.description: The number of remaining refreshes available (per hour, fixed window)

retry_at.description: The datetime when quota for enqueuing new jobs will again be available. Only shown for a 429 response.

get.description: Get a manual job by `job_id`. Manual jobs are completed by a human and include Assisted Benefits jobs.

post.description: Create a new connection (new company/provider pair) with a new account

employee_size.description: Optional: the size of the employer to be created with this connection. Defaults to 20. Note that if this is higher than 100, historical payroll data will not be generated, and instead only one pay period will be created.

post.description: Create a new account for an existing connection (company/provider pair)

put.description: Update an existing sandbox account. Change the connection status to understand how the Finch API responds.

post.summary: Add new individuals to a sandbox company

schema.description: Array of individuals to create. Takes all combined fields from `/individual` and `/employment` endpoints. All fields are optional.
Fields to configure the payment. Takes all fields from the `/payment` endpoint. All fields are optional.

type.description: The type of job to start. Currently the only supported type is `data_sync_all`

job_id.description: The id of the job that has been created.

job_url.description: The url that can be used to retrieve the job status

allowed_refreshes.description: The number of allowed refreshes per hour (per hour, fixed window)

remaining_refreshes.description: The number of remaining refreshes available (per hour, fixed window)

legal_name.description: The legal name of the company.

type.description: The tax payer type of the company.

subtype.description: The tax payer subtype of the company.

primary_email.description: The email of the main administrator on the account.

primary_phone_number.description: The phone number of the main administrator on the account. Format: `XXXXXXXXXX`

accounts.description: An array of bank account objects associated with the payroll/HRIS system.

routing_number.description: A nine-digit code that's based on the U.S. Bank location where your account was opened.

account_number.description: 10-12 digit number to specify the bank account

preferred_name.description: The preferred name of the individual.

ethnicity.description: The EEOC-defined ethnicity of the individual.

ssn.description: Social Security Number of the individual. This field is only available with the `ssn` scope enabled and the `options: { include: ['ssn'] }` param set in the body.

encrypted_ssn.description: Social Security Number of the individual in **encrypted** format. This field is only available with the `ssn` scope enabled and the `options: { include: ['ssn'] }` param set in the body.

body.description: Specific information about the job, such as individual statuses for batch jobs.

account_id.description: The Finch uuid of the account used to connect this company.

products.description: An array of the authorized products associated with the `access_token`.

username.description: The account username used for login associated with the `access_token`.

payroll_provider_id.description: The payroll provider associated with the `access_token`.

manual.description: Whether the connection associated with the `access_token` uses the Assisted Connect Flow. (`true` if using Assisted Connect, `false` if connection is automated)

status.description: If the request is successful, Finch will return “success” (HTTP 200 status).

frequencies.description: The list of frequencies supported by the provider for this benefit

employee_deduction.description: Supported deduction types. An empty array indicates deductions are not supported.

company_contribution.description: Supported contribution types. An empty array indicates contributions are not supported.

annual_maximum.description: Whether the provider supports an annual maximum for this benefit.

catch_up.description: Whether the provider supports catch up for this benefit. This field will only be true for retirement benefits.

hsa_contribution_limit.description: Whether the provider supports HSA contribution limits. Empty if this feature is not supported for the benefit. This array only has values for HSA benefits.

name.description: Identifier indicating whether the benefit was newly enrolled or updated.

finch_code.description: A descriptive identifier for the response

message.description: Short description in English that provides more information about the response.

name.description: Identifier indicating whether the benefit was newly enrolled or updated.

finch_code.description: A descriptive identifier for the response.

message.description: Short description in English that provides more information about the response.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

postal_code.description: The postal code or zip code.

Income.title: Income
Income.description: The employee's income as reported by the provider. This may not always be annualized income, but may be in units of bi-weekly, semi-monthly, daily, etc, depending on what information the provider returns.

unit.description: The income unit of payment. Options: `yearly`, `quarterly`, `monthly`, `semi_monthly`, `bi_weekly`, `weekly`, `daily`, `hourly`, and `fixed`.

effective_date.description: The date the income amount went into effect.

count.description: The total number of elements for the entire query (not just the given page)

offset.description: The current start index of the returned list of elements

BenefitDescription.title: BenefitDescription
BenefitDescription.description: Name of the benefit as it appears in the provider and pay statements. Recommend limiting this to <30 characters due to limitations in specific providers (e.g. Justworks).

amount.description: Contribution amount in cents (if `fixed`) or basis points (if `percent`).

frequencies.description: The list of frequencies supported by the provider for this benefit

employee_deduction.description: Supported deduction types. An empty array indicates deductions are not supported.

company_contribution.description: Supported contribution types. An empty array indicates contributions are not supported.

annual_maximum.description: Whether the provider supports an annual maximum for this benefit.

catch_up.description: Whether the provider supports catch up for this benefit. This field will only be true for retirement benefits.

hsa_contribution_limit.description: Whether the provider supports HSA contribution limits. Empty if this feature is not supported for the benefit. This array only has values for HSA benefits.

ClientType.title: ClientType
ClientType.description: The type of application associated with a token.

ConnectionType.title: ConnectionType
ConnectionType.description:
The type of the connection associated with the token.
- `provider` - connection to an external provider
- `finch` - finch-generated data.

annual_maximum.description: If the benefit supports annual maximum, the amount in cents for this individual.

catch_up.description: If the benefit supports catch up (401k, 403b, etc.), whether catch up is enabled for this individual.

hsa_contribution_limit.description: Type for HSA contribution limit if the benefit is a HSA.

BenefitsSupport.description: Each benefit type and their supported features. If the benefit type is not supported, the property will be null

SupportedFields.description: The supported data fields returned by our HR and payroll endpoints

OperationSupport.description:
- `supported`: This operation is supported by both the provider and Finch
- `not_supported_by_finch`: This operation is not supported by Finch but supported by the provider
- `not_supported_by_provider`: This operation is not supported by the provider, so Finch cannot support
- `client_access_only`: This behavior is supported by the provider, but only available to the client and not to Finch

code.description: The status code of the request.

finch_code.description: A descriptive identifier for the error.

message.description: A short English description that provides more information about the error.

individual_id.description: A stable Finch `id` (UUID v4) for an individual in the company. There is no limit to the number of `individual_id` to send per request. It is preferantial to send all ids in a single request for Finch to optimize provider rate-limits.

method.description: The HTTP method for the forwarded request. Valid values include: `GET` , `POST` , `PUT` , `DELETE` , and `PATCH`.

route.description: The URL route path for the forwarded request. This value must begin with a forward-slash ( / ) and may only contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores.

headers.description: The HTTP headers to include on the forwarded request. This value must be specified as an object of key-value pairs. Example: `{"Content-Type": "application/xml", "X-API-Version": "v1" }`

params.description: The query parameters for the forwarded request. This value must be specified as a valid JSON object rather than a query string.

data.description: The body for the forwarded request. This value must be specified as either a string or a valid JSON object.

API-Version.name: Finch-API-Version
API-Version.description: Header used to specify the version for a given API request. Current version is 2020-09-17.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Used to indicate the original media type of the resource
